net.happybrackets.core.control

Class FloatControlSender

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.happybrackets.core.control.DynamicControlParent
      • net.happybrackets.core.control.FloatControl
        • net.happybrackets.core.control.FloatTextControl
          • net.happybrackets.core.control.FloatControlSender
  • Deprecated. 
    use FloatControl This class encapsulates the functionality of DynamicControl classes of type ControlType.FLOAT in a simple API
    The difference between FloatControlSender and other FloatControl objects is that @link FloatControlSender} does not have a handler, however, you can still retrieve the current value using the FloatControl.getValue()
    All FloatControl objects with the same name and ControlScope will respond to a message send. *
    Both FloatControlSender and FloatTextControl display the approximate value of the control in the HappyBrackets IDE. * Within the IDE, the value of the value of the control can be changed by typing a new value in and pressing the ENTER or RETURN key.
    The FloatControlSender is identical to the FloatTextControl except that FloatControlSender does not have a FloatControl.valueChanged(double)) handler

    See FloatControl for general information about FloatControl classes and how to set the value within your code

    public class FloatControlSender
extends FloatTextControl

    • Method Detail

      • valueChanged

        public void valueChanged(double control_val)
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from class: FloatControl

        When the control receives the value, it will be passed through to the FloatControl.valueChanged(double) listener that is implemented when the class is created.
        For example 
             FloatControl control1 = new FloatControl(this, "Read", 1.0);
     FloatControl control2 = new FloatControl(this, "Read", 1.0){
      @Override
     public void valueChanged(double new_value){
     System.out.println("Read "+ new_value);
     }
     }
     // Setting the value of control1 will cause any objects listening to control1 or control2 to receive the action. EG
     control1.setValue(2.0);  // This will also set the value of control2
        reflected in its FloatControl.valueChanged(double) function, causing Read 2.0 to be printed to standard output.
        Overrides:
        valueChanged in class FloatControl
        Parameters:
        control_val - the value received

      • setControlScope

        public FloatTextControl setControlScope(ControlScope new_scope)
        Deprecated. 
        Changed the scope that the control has. It will update control map so the correct events will be generated based on its scope If the object is ControlScope Sketch or Unique, it will be displayType in the gui
        Overrides:
        setControlScope in class FloatTextControl
        Parameters:
        new_scope - The new Control Scope
        Returns:
        this object
